Ln.description: A word that denotes a person, place, thing, or idea.

Lee.description: A name used to identify a particular person.

Lep.description: A name given to a specific geographical location.

Lem.description: A name given to a specific non-person, non-place entity.

Ll.description: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

Lnl.description: An adjective that is used as a noun.

Lt.description: A word that denotes an action or a state of being.

Lh.description: A word used to express sudden outburst of emotion or feeling.

Lp.description: A morpheme added at the beginning of a word to modify its meaning.

La.description: A shortened form of a word or phrase.

Ls.description: A word that modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb, expressing manner, place, time, or degree.

Lc.description: A word used to connect clauses or sentences or to coordinate words in the same clause.

Lu.description: A word that quantifies an amount or order.

Lur.description: A Roman numeral used to denote a number.

Lr.description: A type of preposition that is placed after the noun, pronoun, or clause that it governs.

Ld.description: A word placed before a noun or pronoun to modify another word in the sentence.

Lk.description: A word or phrase to make the sentence negative.

Va.description: A phonological process that restricts which vowels may be found near each other in a word in Finnish. Va represents words that use the vowels a, o, and u.

Vä.description: Another aspect of vowel harmony in Finnish. Vä represents words that use the vowels ä, ö, and y.

Vaä.description: A representation of words that use a mix of vowels from both Va and Vä classes, especially in compound words or loanwords.

Xp.description: The basic form of a word from which other forms are derived.

Xj.description: The root of a word, devoid of any affixes, inflections or derivations.

Xr.description: A representation of the structural formation of a word.

Xs.description: Used for technical tracking of word origin or source. Not applicable for typical language use.

X.description: A concept used in technical contexts to denote the end character of a parameter. Not typically applicable in language examples.

Sn.description: The base form of the noun. It's typically used for the subject of the sentence.

Sg.description: The case used to show possession or to form the object of certain verbs or prepositions.

Sp.description: The case used to express partiality, quantity or an ongoing action.

Ses.description: The case used to express a temporary state of being.

Str.description: The case used to express a change in state or transformation.

Sine.description: The case used to express being inside or within something.

Sela.description: The case used to express movement out of something.

Sill.description: The case used to express movement into something.

Sade.description: The case used to express location or possession.

Sabl.description: The case used to express movement away from something.

Sall.description: The case used to express movement towards something or to denote the location where an action takes place.

Sab.description: The case used to express the absence or lack of something.

Sko.description: The case used to express the notion of 'with' or 'together with'. It is always used with the possessive suffix.

Sin.description: The case used to express 'by means of' or 'with'. This case is rarely used and has no singular forms in modern Finnish.

Ssti.description: A rare and poetic case used in storytelling. It doesn't have standard forms and appears mainly in ancient poetry and folklore.

Sak.description: The case used for the total object of a verb. It often looks like the nominative or genitive in singular form.

Ny.description: Indicates that the noun is singular, i.e., it refers to one entity.

Nm.description: Indicates that the noun is plural, i.e., it refers to more than one entity.

O1y.description: Indicates possession by the speaker. It's a possessive suffix added to a noun.

O2y.description: Indicates possession by the person being spoken to. It's a possessive suffix added to a noun.

O1m.description: Indicates possession by the speaker and others. It's a possessive suffix added to a noun.

O2m.description: Indicates possession by the persons being spoken to. It's a possessive suffix added to a noun.

O3.description: Indicates possession by someone else, not the speaker or the person being spoken to. It's a possessive suffix added to a noun.

Cc.description: Forms used to compare differences between the two objects they modify (larger, smaller, faster, higher).

Cs.description: Forms used to denote the most extreme degree of something.

Fkin.description: An enclitic that is equivalent to 'also' or 'even' in English.

Fkaan.description: An enclitic that is equivalent to 'either' or 'neither' in English when used in negative sentences.

Fko.description: A particle used to form yes/no questions.

Tn1.description: The base form of the verb, usually ending in '-a' or '-ä'.

Tn2.description: Expresses the manner of an action, usually with the suffix '-en'.

Tn3.description: Indicates a state or condition resulting from the action of the verb, usually with the suffix '-ma' or '-mä'.

Tn4.description: Indicates a necessity or obligation to perform an action, usually with the suffix '-minen'.

Tn5.description: A rarely used form which denotes the object of an action, typically ends with '-maisilla'.
